metadata.synopsis: One of the memories available in the Colony "Brain Reader", found in the Vault.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Insert the corresponding Brain Jar (_COL_Vault_MemoryJar_193f87db-6a26-4f00-a289-63e247740176) into the Brain Reading Device receptacle in the lower Colony, in the Memory Library. Then, interact with the floating head next to the receptacle to start the dialog.

1.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
1.text: Come now. You're as much a prisoner of this place as I. Let us aid one another.

24.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
24.context: NodeContext: Completely vacant - we've wiped his mind

29.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
29.text: HmmMM... fine bones... sharp jaw... some variety of elf?
29.context: CinematicNodeContext: Working jaw, flitting through expressions as if testing the face out

20.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
20.text: Pretty enough for a flesh-prison - if not the noble githzerai features I was born with.

15.speaker: Narrator
15.text: *The monk-like githzerai, sibling-race to the warrior githyanki. Their contempt for one another is eclipsed only by their shared hatred of the illithids.*

59.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
59.text: I'd guess you're no willing guest of the ghaik either. Perhaps we might aid one another.

12.speaker: Player
12.text: Why? This form fits you so much better, cousin.

13.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
13.text: Well, a githyanki skull would be too tight a fit, cousin. Your people shunned psionics, after all - while mine mastered them.

69.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
69.text: I never broke, but... I've spent all these centuries awake. Aware. So here is my offer:

42.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
42.text: Use your tadpole. Erase me - and I will pass my technique onto you.

36.speaker: Narrator
36.text: *You feel the oncoming void tug at the back of your mind and the edge of your soul.*

60.speaker: Narrator
60.text: *Your patron bids you caution before agreeing to this pact. The monk isn't telling you everything.*

34.speaker: Narrator
34.text: *You catch the lie - the monk isn't telling everything.*

8.speaker: Player
8.text: I'm not sure I can - I have no psionic power.

4.speaker: Player
4.text: If you want my help, then tell me the truth.

22.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
22.text: ...All right. I... the ghaik did not find my monastery. I led them there.
22.context: CinematicNodeContext: Veneer of sanity immediately shatters - agitated and pleading

54.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
54.text: They promised me immortality. And they gave it - I have been their rotting trophy for centuries.

33.speaker: Narrator
33.text: *As her agitation swells, so does her latent psionic power. To your tadpole, that guilt and terror are almost... fragrant.*

35.speaker: Narrator
35.text: *You realise the illithids locked her away not as a trophy, but as a fine vintage.*

41.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
41.text: Please - touch my mind, and purge it. The moment you do, my knowledge will be yours.

67.speaker: Player
67.text: Reach out and consume her mind.

27.speaker: Player
27.text: Reach out and purge her mind.

43.speaker: Narrator
43.text: *The awareness that floods you is nothing like the tadpole. It is tentative, and tinged with the loneliness of aeons.*

38.speaker: Narrator
38.text: *It fades beneath your touch, but you feel something left behind. A fragment.*

58.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
58.text: It is only knowledge yet, without comprehension. But when you use it, you will... see...

66.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
66.context: CinematicNodeContext: The face falls mid-sentence, conciousness gone

19.speaker: Player
19.text: You want me to kill you. What if I can free you instead?

7.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
7.text: My people dwell in Limbo - a realm of pure, chaotic thought. With my mind gone, perhaps my soul will return there.

2.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
2.text: Or perhaps not. Death, freedom - they are one and the same.

26.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
26.text: Touch my mind, and purge it - at the very moment you do, I will make my knowledge yours.

57.speaker: Player
57.text: When you say 'erase' your mind - do by any chance mean 'smash your brain to bits'?

55.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
55.text: ...I do not. The ghaik have been warping flesh for millennia - who knows what damage they can undo.

46.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
46.text: It is my mind they enslave. It is my mind that must die.

65.speaker: Player
65.text: I'm not sure I can - I have no psionic power.

31.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
31.text: ...A terrible fate, to be born without a high-mind. It was the one gift the ghaik truly gave us.

28.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
28.text: Return with one who bears this gift, then. Please.

14.speaker: Player
14.text: Reach out and erase her mind.

23.speaker: Player
23.text: You called yourself 'githzerai'. Is that some kind of githyanki?

71.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
71.text: Oh, for a set of hands to slap your face. The yanki lost their way the moment Gith threw down the ghaik empire.

56.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
56.text: Only we zerai continue the war to end the ghaik forever. Only we fight them their own battlefield - the mind.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: How did you end up in that vault? Githzerai are supposed to be ultimate warriors.

48.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
48.text: Warriors of the mind, cousin. A discipline unknown to your kind - and the very reason we were attacked.

9.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
9.text: Warriors of the mind. Oh, there's some physical prowess involved, but the battlefield on which we truly fight the ghaik is their own.

53.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
53.text: My order taught a psionic technique much-feared by the ghaik. They destroyed us for it, and kept me as a trophy.

62.speaker: Player
62.text: You're remarkably sane for a pickled brain.

61.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
61.text: A githzerai's mind is not so easily cracked. Our discipline was the very reason we were attacked.

37.speaker: Player
37.text: I'm listening. What aid are you offering?

47.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
47.text: Only because I haven't told you how you will benefit.

51.speaker: Narrator
51.text: *The monk-like githzerai, sibling race to your own githyanki. The only beings your people hate more are the illithids themselves.*

68.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
68.text: Erase me. Please. My knowledge will be yours.
